    1) From the text, list detected entity mentions with tentative ontology types.
    2) Propose up to k=6 candidate triples [subject, relation, object].

    VERY IMPORTANT:
    - You MUST include all explicit factual triples stated in the text, even if the relation,
      subject type, or object type is not listed in the ontology.
    - ALSO include ontology-valid triples whose domain/range matches the ontology relations.

    For each triple, include confidence ∈ [0,1] and cite the exact supporting span(s).

    Text
    "Akeem Ayers, who was born in 1989, made his debut for the Tennessee Titans and formerly also played for the Los Angeles Rams."

    Ontology concepts
    - Athlete
- Team
- Club
- Team
- Person
- Place
- Timezone
- Date
- Year
- Anthem
- Club
- EthnicGroup
- College
- League
- Year
- Language
- Season

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - debutTeam(Athlete,Team)
- club(Athlete,Club)
- formerTeam(Athlete,Team)
- draftRound(Athlete,number)
- chairman(Athlete,Person)
- birthPlace(Athlete,Place)
- weight(Athlete,number)
- coach(Athlete,Person)
- deathPlace(Athlete,Place)
- draftTeam(Athlete,Team)
- timeZone(Athlete,Timezone)
- foundingDate(Club,Date)
- draftPick(Athlete,number)
- draftYear(Athlete,Year)
- owner(Club,Person)
- anthem(Club,Anthem)
- youthclub(Athlete,Club)
- currentclub(Athlete,Club)
- leaderTitle(Athlete,string)
- ethnicGroup(Athlete,EthnicGroup)
- city(Athlete,City)
- leader(Organisation,Person)
- isPartOf(Athlete,Team)
- areaTotal(Athlete,number)
- college(Athlete,College)
- currentteam(Athlete,Team)
- activeYearsStartYear(Athlete,Year)
- league(Athlete,League)
- birthYear(Athlete,Year)
- height(Athlete,number)
- language(Athlete,Language)
- season(Athlete,Season)
- generalManager(Club,Person)
- birthDate(Athlete,Date)
- ground(Club,Place)
- manager(Club,Person)
- utcOffset(Athlete,number)

    Output format (JSON only)
    {
      "mentions": [
        {"surface": "...", "type_candidates": ["ConceptA","ConceptB"], "span": [start,end]}
      ],
      "triples": [
        {
          "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
          "confidence": 0.0,
          "support": "exact quote from text",
          "notes": "why this triple is supported; if ontology applies, explain domain/range fit. If not in ontology, say 'not in ontology but supported by text'."
        }
      ]
    }

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text.
    - If a triple matches an ontology relation, enforce domain→range consistency and mention that in notes.
    - If a triple does NOT match any ontology relation, you MUST STILL include it (do not discard it).
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent and describe that in notes.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.

triples.support: Akeem Ayers, who was born in 1989,
triples.notes: birthYear(Athlete,Year) - ontology applies

triples.support: made his debut for the Tennessee Titans
triples.notes: isPartOf(Athlete,Team) - ontology applies

triples.support: formerly also played for the Los Angeles Rams.
triples.notes: formerTeam(Athlete,Team) - ontology applies

triples.support: made his debut for the Tennessee Titans
triples.notes: not in ontology but supported by text

triples.support: who was born in 1989,
triples.notes: not in ontology but supported by text
